normalised: think of them as a buffet of cinema, offering everything from indie gems to documentaries that'll blow your mind. forget the usual three hour runtime with six songs and a villain who twirls his mustache. you're talking films that challenge your perspective, introduce you to new cultures, and maybe even make you cry (in a good way!).

normalised: India has a thriving film festival scene. the International Film Festival of India (I F F I) in Goa is huge – seriously, think kilometers of red carpets and screenings. and then there are smaller, more niche festivals popping up all over the country. my friend Priya attended one in Pune last year, the Pune International Film Festival, and she hasn't stopped raving about it. apparently, she saw this amazing Marathi film there and even got to meet the director!

unnormalised: India has a thriving film festival scene. The International Film Festival of India (IFFI) in Goa is HUGE – seriously, think kilometers of red carpets and screenings. And then there are smaller, more niche festivals popping up all over the country. My friend Priya attended one in Pune last year, the Pune International Film Festival, and she hasn’t stopped raving about it. Apparently, she saw this amazing Marathi film there and even got to meet the director!
normalised: these festivals aren't just for snobby film critics, okay? they're for anyone who loves a good story. you get to see films you'd never find in your local multiplex. plus, it's a great way to support independent filmmakers who are telling stories that wouldn't otherwise be heard. imagine being one of the first to discover the next Anurag Kashyap!

normalised: okay, so how do you get involved? most festivals have websites where you can buy passes (sometimes they're even free!). check out the festival programs beforehand to see what piques your interest. don't be afraid to step outside your comfort zone and try something new! you might just discover your next favourite film (and impress all your friends with your refined taste!). so, ditch the Netflix binge for a weekend and give a film festival a shot. you won't regret it. and hey, maybe I'll see you there! rupee five hundred popcorn on me! wink
